title: Celebrating 200 Years of Citi: Agora Partnerships and Citibank Nicaragua S.A. Launch "Citi Líderes" Business Mentoring Program
summary: Managua, Nicaragua - As part of Citi's 200th anniversary celebration around the world, the bank launched a corporate social responsibility program in Nicaragua based on volunteer work by its employees and an alliance with Agora Partnerships.
tag-1: Celebrating 200 Years of Citi: Agora Partnerships and Citibank Nicaragua S.A. Launch "Citi Líderes" Business Mentoring Program
tag-3: Managua, Nicaragua – As part of Citi's 200th anniversary celebration around the world, the bank launched a corporate social responsibility program in Nicaragua based on volunteer work by its employees and an alliance with Agora Partnerships.
tag-4: On May 4 and 11, Agora Partnerships certified 30 volunteers, all of them Citi Nicaragua executives, as business mentors. The certification is the first step in the Citi LíderEs mentorship program, an innovative way to put the talent of Citi Nicaragua employees at the service of small and micro entrepreneurs demonstrating a potential for successful growth.
tag-5: Starting June 1, each volunteer will start a mentorship relationship with a small-business owner selected from Agora's network. The mentoring will continue through December and will aim to support the growth and strengthening of the participating businesses.
tag-6: The funds for Citi LíderEs come from the Citi Foundation, based in New York, and the expertise from Agora Partnerships, an international organization dedicated to promoting the success of businesses with a social, economic and environmental impact.
tag-7: In addition to one-on-one mentoring for seven months, the "Citi LíderEs" program includes a contest for a co-investment fund benefitting participants who are willing to contribute to their own individual funds which, combined with the program's co-investment support, will be used to help them generate new jobs and increase sales.
tag-8: The innovative "Citi LíderEs" program reflects the principles that guide Citi's corporate social responsibility programs, which include forming alliances aimed at improving communities and promoting economic development and new opportunities, especially through training and education.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-11: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-12: Agora Partnerships Agora Partnerships is an organization that accelerates the growth of businesses in Latin America, helping them generate a social, economic or environmental impact. We have offered strategic consulting to more than 150 businesses and training to more than 3,500, attracting more than US$10 million in investment and resources to the region. Agora Partnerships has offices in Washington, D.C. and Managua. For more information, visit www.agorapartnerships.org | Twitter: @AgoraPrntnrships | www.facebook.com/agorapartnerships
